intro: Achilus, commonly known as the lesser centaury, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Gentianaceae. It consists of about 30 species, predominantly found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce small, colorful flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white. They are often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas. Achilus species are valued for their ornamental appeal and have been used in traditional herbal medicine.
